hackathon-description-text: HackPoly '17 is Cal Poly Pomona's 4th annual software/hardware hackathon.
hackathon-rules:
All participating hackers must abide by the 
. 
No soldering allowed.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Develop the best game on any platform of your choice (web/mobile/VR/etc.) The winning team will win VR headsets sponsored by the Game Development & Design Club!
Top 5 teams win an award that includes:
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Wolfram Alpha - Best Use of Wolfram Tech

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: For hackers whose first hackathon is Hackpoly.
A project that can be feasible for kids in middle or high school that helps these students learn more things about the Internet of Things, Robotics, or technology-related topics.
Best hack that applies Internet of Things Technology
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: JPL - Best Internet of Things(IOT) Hack

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3801 W Temple Ave, Pomona, CA 91768, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How difficult was the project to implement technically in the time frame? Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just some lipstick on an API, or were there real technical challenges to surmount?
Is the hack more than just another generic social app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack practical given its target audience? Is it something that the user base would actually use? Does it fulfill a need people have?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well-designed?
This is very difficult to describe, but you'll know it when you see it. The closest description would be a project that makes you feel like you are living in the future.
Did they make an interesting and intriguing game that has a high replay value?

hackathon-location-address: 3801 W Temple Ave, Pomona, CA 91768, USA
hackathon-description-header: The 24 hour intercollegiate hackathon at Cal Poly Pomona for creativity, ingenuity, and technical talent.
hackathon-location-description: California State Polytechnic University, Pomona - Bronco Student Center
